instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_3GH: What is PPBUS_3GH? PPBUS_3GH is a typo of PPBUS_G3H. If you see someone type PPBUS_3GH assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A, that has no image, internal nither external.

It seams to boot (reaches 0.560A), and after a  while it reboots. I can't see any USB activity.

All big coils have voltages, except L7702 that has 0.005V

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
You can't expect video, if no USB activity detected.
Compare CPU core voltage behavior with good board.

Any history available?
Did you try DFU?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I don't have any other board to compare it...

Client said it stoped working over night.

I din't tried DFU. I will now.

Is there any other way to analyze it without with another good board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
HI. 

It isn't recognized in DFU mode. But 

It responds to the power button, fan spins around 2 seconds, and then stops. CPU gets hot

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Does it charge the battery?
Did you try DFU with both charger and (good) battery connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hi.

I've tried DFU with an original 90W charger and a good battery connected.

I think it charges the battery. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_3GH</SIGNAL> gets low after charging (w/o charger conected), and the mac consumes 1.74A (with battery conected) on the ampmetter, before it reboots.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings with reference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]

Try to manually force it in DFU.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message: How can I force DFU? Is there a procedure that you can share?
